intro: Cionosicys excisus, commonly known as the excised cion, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Cionaceae. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring deeply lobed and serrated margins that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it can thrive in the presence of high humidity. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cionosicys excisus is considered a botanically intriguing but understudied species.
